intro: Clinopodium alpestre, commonly known as alpine oregano, is a perennial herb native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Clinopodium alpestre is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
